p: The transwell assay showed that the invasion of A549 cells was induced by 10 Gy IR, and it considerably decreased after treatment with compounds 1–3 ( Figure 5(a)). All tested compounds (at the noncytotoxic concentrations) significantly suppressed the invasiveness of γ-irradiated A549 cells in comparison with that of the untreated γ-irradiated A549 cells ( Figure 5(b)). These results suggested that compounds 1–3 inhibited IR-induced A549 cell invasion at noncytotoxic concentrations.
